definition: achievement/meritorious deed/contributions (for the good of society)

sentences.english: He's worth three chapters in a textbook.
sentences.chinese: 他的功勋彪炳，值得在教科书里大写特写。

sentences.english: Einstein has performed immortal feats for bringing forward the time of terminating the Second World War.
sentences.chinese: 爱因斯坦为二战的结束时间提前，立下了不朽的功勋。

sentences.english: On his cuirass he wore the silver cross of the Legion of Honor.
sentences.chinese: 在他的铁甲上，有个银质的功勋十字章。

sentences.english: Mathematics can be said to be required to build on the achievements is indelible.
sentences.chinese: 可以说反证法为数学所建立的功勋是不可磨灭的。

sentences.english: Now he is, at 38, the grand old man of the N.B.A.
sentences.chinese: 今年，他已经38岁了，成了一位功勋卓著的老兵。

sentences.english: He has remarkable feats in motherland's unification, and was canonized as the Prince by Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 由于维护祖国统一的功勋卓著，被清王朝册封为郡王。

sentences.english: This not "Meritorious service" the inside girl is also singing, is inspiring.
sentences.chinese: 这不《功勋》里面的小姑娘也在唱，多么令人鼓舞。

sentences.english: Gangqiang her hand on the battlefield never ride the establishment of immortal exploits.
sentences.chinese: 她不曾手持钢枪在战场上驰骋，建立不朽的功勋。

sentences.english: His place in the fight for the national interests and in defense of human rights is not modest but great.
sentences.chinese: 他在争取民族利益和捍卫人类权利方面功勋卓著。

sentences.english: He is a loyal official who has made some great contributions.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位屡建功勋的屏藩忠臣。

sentences.english: Merit, as well as birth, now counts for something.
sentences.chinese: 功勋，如今和家世一样，物有所值。

definition: minister who has given outstanding service
the task of establishing and maintaining hegemony
commander-in-chief, the equivalent of king in Chinese chess
order of feudal nobility, namely: Duke 公[gong1], Marquis 侯[hou2], Count 伯[bo2], Viscount 子[zi3], Baron 男[nan2]
